revised_title: Alexander Thomas Glenny: A Life of Order, Method, and Scientific Achievement
tldr: Alexander Thomas Glenny was a prominent figure in the field of immunology and medical research. He made significant contributions to the organization and efficiency of laboratories, particularly the Welcome Physiological Research Laboratories. Glenny's passion for order and method allowed him to excel in managing large-scale research projects and played a crucial role in the development of antitoxic sera during World War I. His dedication to his work and his ability to understand complex data quickly made him a respected and influential figure in the scientific community.
